name: Kon Tiki Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first stop on a 3 night coastal drive from LA to SF. Was a good size room with a great view of the beach and a comfortable bed. Price was decent and breakfast was modest, but ok for free. Probably wish we had a bit more time to enjoy the beach. Would recommend.
reviews.title: Great for an overnight stay

reviews.text: Love this place, always consistently good service and very accommodating to our requests, including asking people to smoke in designated areas. Great for families, especially younger children. Will stay nowhere else!
reviews.title: Go-to vacation spot for our family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wanted to take my wife, for out 18th Anniversary to Jacko's for dinner. It's too far of a drive to go there and back in same day. I went on line and somehow found Kon Tiki Inn. The price was very reasonable and the location looked excellent! When we arrived checked in and went to our room. What a beautiful view of the ocean and surrounding area of Pismo Beach. We spent the day walking the sand and went downtown Pismo too. The weather was outstanding as well. We went to Jacko's in Nipomo had a GREAT dinner and went back to our room. We sat on the Patio staring out at the beach for hours enjoying the sounds of the breaking waters. It was a great Anniversary. I will make it point to stay at the Kon Tiki Inn several times a year going forward! Rooms clean and staff very friendly and helpful. I forgot to mention the free breakfast they offer. It's full on buffet. Anything you'd want to eat will be right in front of you to eat!
reviews.title: Great Ambiance !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed here once a year for many years and find the friendliness of the staff and the cleaniness of the property are always consistent. The vibe of the hotel agrees with the laid back feel of Pismo. Also, the views from all the rooms couldn't be better and direct access to the beach make long walks in the morning something we look forward to. Although the furniture is a bit dated, it is well maintained and comfortable. We've stayed at almost all other hotels in the area but find Kon Tiki the best overall.
reviews.title: Always a Pleasant Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: best hotel for the money in Pismo beach. We go there 4 - 5 times a year and it is always great. every room has ocean view. get a room on the first floor and walk out of your room and down the stairs right to the beach.
reviews.title: GREAT- AS USUAL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed three nights to the sound of the waves. We are always greeted by a friendly staff and a clean room. We always return to the KonTiki for family pleasure and never are disappointed. The location is excellent, the fittness center is outstanding .Steamers next door offers the best Happy Hour around. It is a mainstay with our family for over 30 years. Thank you Kon Tiki!!!
reviews.title: "Great Spot"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night at the Kon Tiki Inn in Pismo Beach on our way to Santa Barbara from the Bay Area. Great place at the right price. All rooms have ocean views with private balconies (ask for the third floor for evern more scenic view). Just a few feet from the beach and near the pier. Right next door is Steamers Restaurant - so very convenient. Accommodating staff. FREE parking. Wish they had a microwave in the room but they do have a fridge. Breakfast is included. There is also a pool.
reviews.title: Kon Tiki Inn Doesn't Disappoint

reviews.text: We came here for a girl's weekend and this is a really nice place. The view really can't be beat!
reviews.title: Right on the water!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good pool, two hot tubs. Free breakfast in the morning - waffles, bagels, cereal, etc.
reviews.title: What a view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very nice.
reviews.title: Good halfway house

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had hoped for better weather and pictured our two nights here being a beach break element of our road trip. Hence we booked a hotel that didn't really float our boat style wise but was right on the beautiful looking wide sandy beach. As it was breezy and cool this didn't quite come off but the beach is indeed fabulous and we enjoyed walking on it and the hotel's pool and hot tubs were nice and we appreciated the wind breaker around it so managed a couple of hours of lounging. I thought it fairly expensive for a pretty basic feeling hotel but I guess this comes down to California being pretty pricey generally. We had a lovely meal at the restaurant next door - much better qaulity food than what I had expected. Pismo wasn't a great place. Two nights was plenty. But a lovely beach and all the staff at the hotel were very friendly. No complaints; would recommend.
reviews.title: nice friendly place right on the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose the Kon Tiki Inn based on the reviews, and was completely satisfied with our stay. This place is not a luxury resort, but offers a similar experience with it's location over the ocean and a great pool and hot tub. We spent a considerable amount of time on our little deck, as the views are stunning no matter the time of day; a great place to have coffee in the morning and most especially a glass of wine at sunset. The property is well maintained, rooms are very clean, and the beds are very comfortable. We had one minor inconvenience with the air conditioner, and after calling the desk someone was there to resolve the issue within one minute. I would highly recommend the Kon Tiki to anyone looking for an affordable place to unwind and relax in Pismo Beach.
reviews.title: Great choice!!

reviews.text: Just came back from staying at the Kon Tiki and had such an awesome experience that I have to figure out how to go back again real soon. Every room has an ocean view and ours had a fireplace, too. We stood on the patio when we arrived and just took in the beauty of the ocean. The pool is small but they have two spas that have a beautiful view of the beach. I walked down to downtown on the beach and the entire shore was covered with sand dollars. The staff was really nice and helpful. The hotel felt more like a home away from home. The continental breakfast was huge, make your own waffles, yogurt, bagels, boiled eggs, oatmeal, etc. If you visit here bring your own beach towel, lotion and conditioner.
reviews.title: Ocean view and a fireplace
Spectacular ocean views
reviews.text: We came here for our anniversary. Great location. Clean room. Comfy bed. Updated bathroom. Even had a couch and seating area in the room. Full breakfast. We didn't use the TV because we were so mesmerized by the ocean view! Steps down to the beach. Great price! We weren't used to water softener so that was interesting. Couldn't hear any noises from other guests. Just relaxing and beautiful!

This is where we have out of town guests stay. It's on it's own lot, with lots of parking, and separate gym (Pismo Beach Athletic Club - you get a free day pass). Every room is ocean view, there's a nice pool and hot-tubs in front of the building, beyond which is a 70 foot cliff and the Pacific Ocean. Hotel has its own staircase directly to the beach. You're out of the downtown core (so no noise or traffic hassles) but you can walk to downtown in 5 minutes.
reviews.title: Go-To Spot for Pismo - Right on the water, private, walk to downtown, good value

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights with my sisters and simply fell in love with the place. It's not fancy, but it's clean, comfy and affordable. Stayed on the first floor, loved that all rooms have an ocean view. We felt safe enough to keep the door open at night to sleep to the sound of waves. Great location, just a beach walk to several bars and restaurants. Steamers, the on-site restaurant was great, they even had live music. Very nice complimentary breakfast too! Going back in October, counting the days!!
reviews.title: Love at First Sight

reviews.text: If you are looking for a good value and you don't require frills like room service then this is the place for you! Staff was friendly helpful,rooms were clean. If you require a place with new furniture and paint and matching umbrellas at the pool then again not for you. The breakfast was perfect for us. We are a family looking for a nice clean hotel that would not break the bank!
reviews.title: Cant't beat this view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently spent 2 nights and loved it!:) Very happy with the location - enjoyed walking on the beach. Rooms are nice and clean-nothing fancy but great ocean view, deck off room and loved having the sliding door open all night to enjoy the waves crashing. We would stay again!
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel last october as part of our honeymoon. Nothing fancy about it but nice spacious bedroom with a view to die for, we had only booked 2 nights but would have loved to be able to stay longer. Everthing was clean, it was peaceful and the breakfast in the morning was great. Will def be back when we visit the west coast again!
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay!

reviews.text: We love to stay here and have for about 10 years. All rooms have ocean views and are very comfortable and clean. Staff is friendly and very helpful. The continental breakfast is a normal fare for hotel breakfasts nothing special. A nice walk on the beach will take you downtown to lots of places to eat and shop. Will return to this hotel at least once a year.
reviews.title: Best hotel around

description: Swaying palms, a smooth sandy beach and the sounds of the Pacific Ocean all welcome you to the Kon Tiki Inn, where every room features a panoramic ocean view. Located on the coastline midway between San Francisco and Los Angeles, our oceanfront inn is perched on a bluff overlooking the stunning and serene Pacific Ocean. From the comfort of your guest room watch a glorious sunset or catch a glimpse of a whale. During the day choose from a variety of outdoor activities and at night fall asleep to the rhythmic sound of ocean waves.The guest room décor reflects our seaside location with a neutral and ocean-toned palette accented by natural wood, tropical prints, and rich detail. Our hotel features rooms with one king bed or one king with one queen bed.
